article.name: Why does the capacity in the metric graph deviate from the value of capacity checked by the OS or other means?
article.title: Why does the capacity in the metric graph deviate from the value of capacity checked by the OS or other means?
article.body:
When converting metric graph values to units, Mackerel calculates them by dividing by 1000(10^n), which is a power of 10.

Some OS or tools may use 1024(2^n), which is a power of 2, for unit conversion, so the size may differ when compared, but this is a specification.
